body_content.explanation: the food and drink usually eaten or drunk by a person or group:
examples: Diet varies between different countries in the world.
The benefits of a healthy diet are obvious.
Choose a varied diet rich in whole grains, vegetables, and fruits, and low in saturated fats.
It is important for children to have a balanced diet.
Rice is the staple diet (= most important food) of many people in China.
The children seem to exist on a diet of fried food.

body_content.explanation: an eating plan in which someone eats less food, or only particular types of food, because they want to become thinner or for medical reasons:
examples: I'm going on a diet next week and hope to lose ten pounds before Christmas.
Following his recent health scare, my boss is now on a diet.
The doctor put me on a low-salt diet to reduce my blood pressure.
Low calorie crash diets do not work.
She runs at least three times a week and eats a very strict organic diet.
By May I had lost four stone by following a calorie-controlled diet.

body_content.explanation: a particular type of thing that you experience or do regularly, or a limited range of activities:
examples: He was brought up on a diet of political propaganda from birth.
Network TV only offers a diet of bad reality shows every night.

body_content.explanation: Diet food or drink contains less sugar or fat than the usual type, and often contains an artificial sweetener:
to limit the food and/or drink that you have, especially in order to lose weight:
examples: You should be able to reduce your weight by careful dieting.
